Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Fixed bug in rules event qualification output. Jan

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Bugfix - Range table entries that are unused after rewriting should not be marked inFromCl any longer. Otherwise the planner gets confused and joins over them where in fact it does not have to. Adjust hasSubLinks now with a recursive lookup - could be wrong in multi action rules because parse state isn't reset correctly and all actions in the rule are marked hasSubLinks if one of them has. Jan

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: *** empty log message ***

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: pgindent run over code.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: pgindent run over code.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Get rid of page-level locking in btree-s. LockBuffer is used to acquire read/write access to index pages. Pages are released before leaving index internals.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Get rid of page-level locking in btree-s. BT_READ/BT_WRITE are BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE/BUFFER_LOCK_EXCLUSIVE now. Also get rid of #define BT_VERSION_1 - we use version 1 as default for near two years now.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make 0x007f -> (unsigned)0x7f to make pgindent happy.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Another pgindent run. Sorry folks.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: Give BEOS a chance ...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make functions static or NOT_USED as appropriate.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow pg_dump -v display proper table/sequence count display.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add fix for 0x7fU constants to pgindent

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Disable use of -o and -d pg_dump options together. Can't set oids in inserts. Change some variables to bool to be clearer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for NT from Horak Daniel

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: First copy from the man pages. postgres-ref.sgml is not yet marked up.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add new reference pages for postmaster and postgres. Normalize markup for vacuumdbSEMICOLON content is the same.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Chapter on multi-version concurrency control from Vadim. Some wording changes from Vadim's original text doc. Processes cleanly, but may need fixup.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add chapters on CVS access, MVCC, SQL theory to the docs. Add an appendix with more details on date/time attributes and handling. Update most references to Postgres version numbers to 6.5, *except* for the porting list which will require a report from a successful installation to be updated.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow GROUPs to be dumped properly.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Display numeric precision on BACKSLASHd.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix compile of plpgsql by adding 'extern int yylineno.'

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix pg_dump to use the same maximum-query-size constant as the backend does. Remove unnecessary limitation on field size in dumpClasses_dumpData (ie, -d or -D case).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Patch from Andreas: when CREATE TABLE is followed by CREATE INDEX before any tuples are loaded, preserve the default '1000 tuples' table size estimate.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for crypt memory leak, from James Thompson

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I am not sure if libpq++ will compile with non g++ compilers, but the Makefile does break non g++. <<mak.patch>> Andreas

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up release sgml file.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update release notes for 6.5.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Significant update from Vince Vielhaber.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Refresh FreeBSD info.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Remove disclaimer about exact numeric types. They work now!

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Significant updates from Vince Vielhaber.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Markup fixes. Update for v6.5 release.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Markup fixes.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: FAQs contributed for this release.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: More info is in sgml and html docs so this is now obsolete.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make pg_dump dump ACL's by default, print warning on use of -z, and add new -x option to skip acl dump.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When closure of the backend connection is detected during pqFlush, do the right thing: look for a NOTICE message from the backend before we close our side of the socket. 6.4 libpq did not reliably print the backend's hara-kiri message, 'The Postmaster has informed me ...', because it only did the right thing if connection closure was detected during a read attempt instead of a write attempt.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update pygresql version stamp.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up mention of gmake vs. make.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair performance problem in SI segment manipulations: iterating through MAXBACKENDS array entries used to be fine when MAXBACKENDS = 64. It's not so cool with MAXBACKENDS = 1024 (or more!), especially not in a frequently-used routine like SIDelExpiredDataEntries. Repair by making procState array size be the soft MaxBackends limit rather than the hard limit, and by converting SIGetProcStateLimit() to a macro.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up inefficient and just plain bad code in some hot-spot cache access routines.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: new_relation_targetlist used to cause about 8 separate (and redundant) SearchSysCache searches per table column in an INSERT, which accounted for a good percentage of the CPU time for INSERT ... VALUES(). Now it only does two searches in the typical case.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid redundant SysCache searches in coerce_type, for another few percent speedup in INSERT...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Missing semicolons in non-HAS_TEST_AND_SET code paths :-(

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Fix xid table sizing.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Run all pg_dump queries in single serializable transaction. 2. Get rid of locking when updating statistics in vacuum. 3. Use QuerySnapshot in COPY TO and call SetQuerySnashot in main tcop loop before FETCH and COPY TO.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Turns out that configure's test for HPUXMATHLIB didn't work when used with egcs --- now it does.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: configure.in forgot to do AC_LANG_C to reselect C-based tests after checking for presence of C++ compiler. Odd we hadn't seen any reports of problems before...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace static rcsid[] strings by IDENTIFICATION comments in file headers, to conform to established Postgres coding style and avoid warnings from gcc.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: egcs thinks omitting the return type in a function declaration is poor coding style. I agree.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up uninitialized-variable warning from egcs. (Curious that gcc doesn't complain about this code...).

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Release XactLockTable share lock immediately after this lock is acquired (no sense to hold it) or we'll be out of lock entries. Great thanks to Hiroshi Inoue.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: NT similar file update.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Correct serious bug in hashtable expansion routine: under the right circumstances it would leave old and new bucket headers pointing to the same list of records.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Round up shmem size estimate to 1Kb boundary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Generate a more specific error message when an operator used in an index doesn't have a restriction selectivity estimator.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up memory leaks in LO operations by freeing LO's private memory context at transaction commit or abort.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some latent bugs in dllist.c (carelessness about setting all fields that should be set). Add a MoveToFront primitive to speed up one of the hotspots in SearchSysCache.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: commented out PgConnection& references for now. May be using them later. Vince.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: forgot to attach the patch. :( Vince.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: typedef struct LTAG { Oid relIdSEMICOLON Oid dbIdSEMICOLON union { BlockNumber blknoSEMICOLON TransactionId xidSEMICOLON } objIdSEMICOLON > > Added: > /* > * offnum should be part of objId.tupleId above, but would increase > * sizeof(LOCKTAG) and so moved hereSEMICOLON currently used by userlocks only. > */ > OffsetNumber offnumSEMICOLON uint16 lockmethodSEMICOLON /* needed by userlocks */ } LOCKTAGSEMICOLON gmake clean required... User locks are ready for 6.5 release...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make sure that only one intro is included in the integrated doc. Multiple intros cause trouble since they have some section elements (e.g. "y2k.sgml") in common leading to duplicate labels. Include emacs formatting hints in the intro*.sgml sources.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The INET and CIDR types mistakenly compared 198.68.123.0/24 and 198.68.123.0/27 the same when indexing them. D'Arcy

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Changed "current." into "old." in rule string backparsing Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ooops ... dllist.c can't use Assert() when it is compiled into libpq ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure consistent results when FormSortKeys fails to find all the expected keys (it was returning uninitialized memory).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: pg_dump failed on any database containing large objects, because it ignored the LOs themselves but failed to ignore the indexes on the LOs. How long has this been broken??

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: New versions of hardcopy for 6.5 release.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: CGM format from Hannu. Seem to have lost the .ag original :(

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Markup changes for v6.5 release. Clean out duplicate stuff in odbc.sgml resulting from a faulty patch.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. MyProc->xid assignment is moved to GetNewTransactionId so newer transactions will not assume that MyProc transaction was committed before snapshot calculations. With old MyProc->xid assignment (in xact.c:StartTransaction()) there was ability to see the same row twice (I used gdb for this)!... 2. Assignments of InvalidTransactionId to MyProc->xid and MyProc->xmin are moved from xact.c:CommitTransaction() to xact.c:RecordTransactionCommit() - this invalidation must be done before releasing transaction locks or bad (too high) XmaxRecent value might be used by vacuum ("ERROR: Child itemid marked as unused" reported by "Hiroshi Inoue" <Inoue@tpf.co.jp>SEMICOLON once again, gdb allowed me reproduce this error).

Document.document: Notes in Migration to v6.5 section.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Unuseful tuple.t_data->t_infomask & HEAP_XMIN_COMMITTED in vc_scanheap().

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Additional fix against ERROR: Child itemid marked as unused in CommitTransaction(). 2. Changes in GetSnapshotData().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Thanks for this, but SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL should be described like SET TIME ZONE: TO is not allowed, as well as DEFAULT option. There are only two forms: for Vadim.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL SERIALIZABLESEMICOLON SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ COMMITTEDSEMICOLON ^^^^ required Also note that SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL change isolevel for _current_ transaction, in accordance with standard, not for session (ALTER SESSION is used in Oracle, but it's not implemented currently). And I would don't mention SET XACTISOLEVEL TO ... form at all. Please update set.sgml - I failed to understand all these SET TIME ZONE { '<REPLACEABLE CLASS="PARAMETER"> now. for Vadim

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Turns out OIDNAMELEN wasn't really being used at all! Get rid of it to make customization of NAMEDATALEN easier.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add configurable option controlling security checks in LO functions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add startup-time check that -B is not unreasonably small for given number of backends (-N), per recent discussion in pghackers list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress indexes on large objects from psql's BACKSLASHd listingSEMICOLON they were confusing because the large object tables themselves are not shown. (Besides, if you've got hundreds or thousands of large objects, you really don't want to see 'em at all.) Also, suppress all indexes from the BACKSLASHz ACL listing, since indexes have no meaningful protection information.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update with more TODO items.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ's for release.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: ecpg.patch (wrong makefile expansion in some cases) the ecpg Makefiles use a variable DESTDIR which is never defined except by debian/rules makefile, in which case the ecpg makefiles expand wrong pathnames. If we want to support a DESTDIR root it must be done consistently in all the makefiles, not just in ecpg. From: Massimo Dal Zotto <dz@cs.unitn.it>

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: man.patch (make inconsistency) the default target is 'install' instead of 'all'. So if you do a make without target you actually do a make install, which is not what one normally expects from a standard makefile. From: Massimo Dal Zotto <dz@cs.unitn.it>

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: trace.patch (compilation error) the gettimeofday doesn't compile under Linux with glibc2 because the DST_NONE constant is no more defined. It seems that this code (written by me) has always be wrong but for some reason working. From: Massimo Dal Zotto <dz@cs.unitn.it>

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: a fix for Win32 support provided by yutaka@marin.or.jp. The patch will avoid to add .exe suffix to the pg_encoding binary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove redeclarations of default parameter values from PgDatabase::DisplayTuples and PgDatabase::PrintTuples. This is incorrect according to strict interpretation of the C++ spec, and some compilers will reject it. Also silence g++ warning about unused parameter.

Document.author: momjian

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hi, I have updated my contrib code for version 6.5. In the attachment you will find the directories array, datetime, miscutil, string, tools and userlocks which replace the corresponding directories under contrib. In contrib/tools you will find some developement scripts which I use while hacking the sources. I hope they will be useful for some other people. I have also added a contrib/Makefile which tries to compile and install all the contribs. Unfortunately many of them don't have a Makefile or don't compile cleanly. -- Massimo Dal Zotto

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update from Massimo

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Instead of failing when the constructed name for a sequence, index, etc is too long, truncate until it fits.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: I used bad style of comments and ... commented out some code in EvalPlanQualNext() when implemented it... -:) Uncommented...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix problems with grouping/aggregation in queries that use inheritance ... basically it was completely busted :-(

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a regression test case to catch breakage of GROUP BY and aggregate functions in queries that use inheritance.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: equal() needs a case for Aggref nodes, as shown by: regression=> select sum(q1) from int8_tbl group by q2 order by sum(q1)SEMICOLON NOTICE: equal: don't know whether nodes of type 107 are equal

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. xact.c: update comments about changing MyProc->xid and MyProc->xmin. 2. varsup.c:ReadNewTransactionId(): don't read nextXid from disk - this func doesn't allocate next xid, so ShmemVariableCache->nextXid may be used (but GetNewTransactionId() must be called first). 3. vacuum.c: change elog(ERROR, "Child item....") to elog(NOTICE) - this is not ERROR, proper handling is just not implemented, yet. 4. s_lock.c: increase S_MAX_BUSY by 2 times. 5. shmem.c:GetSnapshotData(): have to call ReadNewTransactionId() _after_ SpinAcquire(ShmemIndexLock).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Have to release meta page before reading root one! < 6.5 versions were just not affected by this bug due to locking.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair recently-introduced error in makeIndexable for LIKE: a non-leading % would be put into the >=/<= patterns. Also, repair longstanding confusion about whether %% means a literal %%. The SQL92 doesn't say any such thing, and textlike() knows that, but gram.y didn't.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Here is a small patch that should only affect win32 building > (native win32, not cygnus). > It does the following: > Patches two win32.mak files to DEFINE HAVE_VSNPRINTF and > HAVE_STRDUP. This is required to build at all. > Bumps the version number on libpq.dll from 6.4 to 6.5. > Required for install programs to work. > Adds defintions for BLCKSZ and MAXIMUM_ALIGN to "win32.h" in > the client-side libpiq directory. > > All these files are only used when building on native win32, > so it should be safe I think. > > Again, really sorry to throw this in so late, but I would > hate to do the same thing as with 6.4 (which required 6.4.1 > to at all compile on Win32). > > Thanks, > > //Magnus

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Concurrency... Highest one... DO NOT EVEN TRY TO DO PageGetMaxOffsetNumber BEFORE LockBuffer! -:)

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: On AIX 4.3.2 the third line in template/aix_42: SHARED_LIB: needs to be changed to: SHARED_LIB:-lc I think this was also needed on AIX 4.2. Comments Please !! If nobody objects, I suggest to make this change, since it cannot break AIX 4.2 and is necessary on AIX 4.3 Andreas

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I attach a patch for pg_upgrade. This does two things: 1. check whether the program is being executed in $PGDATA/.. This is necessary if the data tree is not in the standard place, as is the case with the Debian distribution (because of Debian policy). 2. give a clearer error message if the dumped data structure fails to be loaded. Oliver Elphick

Document.document: Remove optimization on linux/alpha.

Document.document: Linux-alpha gets -O

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: MVCC updation.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: MVCC updates.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Reset evaluation plan tuple table next free slot counter to 0 after ExecEndNode. It must be done! Or we'll be out of free tuple slots very soon, though slots are freed by ExecEndNode and ready for reusing. We didn't see this problem before because of int nSlots = ExecCountSlotsNode(plan)SEMICOLON TupleTable tupleTable = ExecCreateTupleTable(nSlots + 10)SEMICOLON /* why add ten? - jolly */ code in InitPlan - i.e. extra 10 slots. Simple select uses 3 slots and so it was possible to re-use evaluation plan 3 additional times and didn't get elog(NOTICE, "Plan requires more slots than are available")SEMICOLON elog(ERROR, "send mail to your local executor guru to fix this")SEMICOLON Changes are obvious and shouldn't be problems with them. Though, I added Assert(epqstate->es_tupleTable->next == 0) before EvalPlanQual():ExecInitNode and we'll notice if something is still wrong. Is it better to change Assert to elog(ERROR) ?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove -O2 for linux/alpha, make -O.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make minor changes in wording. Adjust tags to get a clean build.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add mention of hot backups to the release notes. Add id tags to chapter and section headings to ensure good labels on output html files.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix errors in SELECT ... GROUP BY ... UNION SELECT ... ye proverbial one-line patch (not counting five lines of comment so's maybe it won't happen again)

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Fix for elog(ERROR, "EvalPlanQual: t_xmin is uncommitted ?!") and possibly for other cases too: DO NOT cache status of transaction in unknown state (i.e. non-committed and non-aborted ones) Example: T1 reads row updated/inserted by running T2 and cache T2 status. T2 commits. Now T1 reads a row updated by T2 and with HEAP_XMAX_COMMITTED in t_infomask (so cached T2 status is not changed). Now T1 EvalPlanQual gets updated row version without HEAP_XMIN_COMMITTED -> TransactionIdDidCommit(t_xmin) and TransactionIdDidAbort(t_xmin) return FALSE and T2 decides that t_xmin is not committed and gets ERROR above. It's too late to find more smart way to handle such cases and so I just changed xact status caching and got rid TransactionIdFlushCache() from code. Changed: transam.c, xact.c, lmgr.c and transam.h - last three just because of TransactionIdFlushCache() is removed. 2. heapam.c: T1 marked a row for update. T2 waits for T1 commit/abort. T1 commits. T3 updates the row before T2 locks row page. Now T2 sees that new row t_xmax is different from xact id (T1) T2 was waiting for. Old code did Assert here. New one goes to HeapTupleSatisfiesUpdate. Obvious changes too. 3. Added Assert to vacuum.c 4. bufmgr.c: break Assert(buf->r_locks == 0 && !buf->ri_lock) into two Asserts.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Added 2 regression tests for NUMERIC data type. 1. Using 100 digits after decimal point on the default make runtest. 2. Using 1000 digits after decimal point in a new target make bigtest. At the end of 'make runtest', a hint about the new bigtest is printed. Jan

Document.document: Change mdtruncate to truncate and not unlink. Hiroshi Inoue

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: More about chained mode and isolation levels.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: More about chained mode and isolation.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Removed bad Assert(!buf->ri_lock) when unlocking exclusively locked buffer.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Change Assert(Ptp.t_data->t_xmax == tp.t_data->t_xmin) to : /* * Read above about cases when !ItemIdIsUsed(Citemid) * (child item is removed)... Due to the fact that * at the moment we don't remove unuseful part of * update-chain, it's possible to get too old * parent row here. Like as in the case which * caused this problem, we stop shrinking here. * I could try to find real parent row but want * not to do it because of real solution will * be implemented anyway, latter, and we are too * close to 6.5 release. - vadim 06/11/99 */ if (Ptp.t_data->t_xmax != tp.t_data->t_xmin) ...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: add m86 similar entries.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hi, please apply the included patch. It corrects the headers in src/win32 - there are some missing #endif. Dan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I don't like last minute patches before the final freeze, but I believe that this one could be useful for people experiencing out-of-memory crashes while executing queries which retrieve or use a very large number of tuples. The problem happens when storage is allocated for functions results used in a large query, for example: select upper(name) from big_tableSEMICOLON select big_table.array[1] from big_tableSEMICOLON select count(upper(name)) from big_tableSEMICOLON This patch is a dirty hack that fixes the out-of-memory problem for the most common cases, like the above ones. It is not the final solution for the problem but it can work for some people, so I'm posting it. The patch should be safe because all changes are under #ifdef. Furthermore the feature can be enabled or disabled at runtime by the `free_tuple_memory' options in the pg_options file. The option is disabled by default and must be explicitly enabled at runtime to have any effect. To enable the patch add the follwing line to Makefile.custom: CUSTOM_COPT += -DFREE_TUPLE_MEMORY To enable the option at runtime add the following line to pg_option: free_tuple_memory=1 Massimo

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Reversed out Massimo patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When targetlist is NULL, ExecTargetList was passing back a pointer to palloc'd but uninitialized memory. This is not coolSEMICOLON anyone looking at the returned 'tuple' would at best coredump and at worst behave in a bizarre and irreproducible way. Fix it to return a predictable value, namely a correctly-set-up palloc'd tuple containing zero attributes. I believe this fix is both safe and critical.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Plug hole in dike: planner would coredump if query_planner returned NULL, which it will do in some cases where an elog(ERROR) would probably be more appropriate. For the moment, generate a not-very- informative error message rather than proceeding to certain coredump. Probably ought to think about making query_planner elog instead of returning NULL, but this is at least a safe change for now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove query_planner's overhasty rejection of cases where tlist and qual are NULL. It ought to handle these the same as the cases where tlist contains only constant expressions, ie, be willing to generate a Result-node plan. This did not use to matter, but it does now because union_planner will flatten the tlist when aggregates are present. Thus, 'select count(1) from table' now causes query_planner to be given a null tlist, and to duplicate 6.4's behavior we need it to give back a Result plan rather than refusing the query. 6.4 was arguably doing the Wrong Thing for this query, but I'm not going to open a semantics issue right before 6.5 release ... can revisit that problem later.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix critical error noticed by Massimo: copy.c used to have a special hack to ensure it would close its output file even after failure due to elog(ERROR) partway through the copy. This is now unnecessary because fd.c takes care of cleaning up open files at transaction abortSEMICOLON worse, after fd.c closed the file copy.c would try to do so *again* at the start of the next COPY command. This would result in havoc in most implementations of stdio library.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Move default NBuffers setting into config.h, and rename it to DEF_NBUFFERS for readability. Make sure the default value is OK according to postmaster.c's new sanity check for -B values.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: change #if defined(__mc68000__) to: #if defined(__mc68000__) && defined(__linux__) so that other m68k systems(such as NetBSD) will not be affected.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Temporarily disable error checks for missing selectivity functions, in order to work around oversight in 6.5 release: rtree index functions haven't got any. Mea culpa ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Create a generic expression-tree-walker subroutine, which will gradually replace all of the boilerplate tree-walk-recursion code that currently exists in O(N) slightly different forms in N subroutines. I've had it with adding missing cases to these subroutines...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: My first chosen victim for expression_tree_walker conversion is parse_aggs.c. This fixes its failure to cope with (at least) CaseExpr and ArrayRef nodes, which is the reason why both of these fail in 6.5: select coalesce(f1,0) from int4_tbl group by f1SEMICOLON ERROR: Illegal use of aggregates or non-group column in target list select sentence.words[0] from sentence group by sentence.words[0]SEMICOLON ERROR: Illegal use of aggregates or non-group column in target list The array case still fails, but at least it's not parse_agg's fault anymore ... considering that we now support CASE officially, I think it's important to fix the first example ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up problems with sublinks + grouping in planner. Not sure if they are all fixed, because rewriter is now the stumbling block, but at least some cases work that did not work before.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace rewriter's checkQueryHasAggs and checkQueryHasSubLink with expression_tree_walker-based code. The former failed to cope with expressions containing SubLinks, and the latter returned TRUE for both SubLinks and Aggrefs (cut-and-paste bug?). There is a lot more scope for using expression_tree_walker in this module, but I'll restrain myself until the 6.6 split occurs from touching not-demonstrably-broken code.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Bugfix - Range table entries that are unused after rewriting should not be marked inFromCl any longer. Otherwise the planner gets confused and joins over them where in fact it does not have to. Adjust hasSubLinks now with a recursive lookup - could be wrong in multi action rules because parse state isn't reset correctly and all actions in the rule are marked hasSubLinks if one of them has. Jan

Document.author: meskes

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: *** empty log message ***

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I don't like last minute patches before the final freeze, but I believe that this one could be useful for people experiencing out-of-memory crashes while executing queries which retrieve or use a very large number of tuples. The problem happens when storage is allocated for functions results used in a large query, for example: select upper(name) from big_tableSEMICOLON select big_table.array[1] from big_tableSEMICOLON select count(upper(name)) from big_tableSEMICOLON This patch is a dirty hack that fixes the out-of-memory problem for the most common cases, like the above ones. It is not the final solution for the problem but it can work for some people, so I'm posting it. The patch should be safe because all changes are under #ifdef. Furthermore the feature can be enabled or disabled at runtime by the `free_tuple_memory' options in the pg_options file. The option is disabled by default and must be explicitly enabled at runtime to have any effect. To enable the patch add the follwing line to Makefile.custom: CUSTOM_COPT += -DFREE_TUPLE_MEMORY To enable the option at runtime add the following line to pg_option: free_tuple_memory=1 Massimo

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Cleanup

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Fix for elog(ERROR, "EvalPlanQual: t_xmin is uncommitted ?!") and possibly for other cases too: DO NOT cache status of transaction in unknown state (i.e. non-committed and non-aborted ones) Example: T1 reads row updated/inserted by running T2 and cache T2 status. T2 commits. Now T1 reads a row updated by T2 and with HEAP_XMAX_COMMITTED in t_infomask (so cached T2 status is not changed). Now T1 EvalPlanQual gets updated row version without HEAP_XMIN_COMMITTED -> TransactionIdDidCommit(t_xmin) and TransactionIdDidAbort(t_xmin) return FALSE and T2 decides that t_xmin is not committed and gets ERROR above. It's too late to find more smart way to handle such cases and so I just changed xact status caching and got rid TransactionIdFlushCache() from code. Changed: transam.c, xact.c, lmgr.c and transam.h - last three just because of TransactionIdFlushCache() is removed. 2. heapam.c: T1 marked a row for update. T2 waits for T1 commit/abort. T1 commits. T3 updates the row before T2 locks row page. Now T2 sees that new row t_xmax is different from xact id (T1) T2 was waiting for. Old code did Assert here. New one goes to HeapTupleSatisfiesUpdate. Obvious changes too. 3. Added Assert to vacuum.c 4. bufmgr.c: break Assert(buf->r_locks == 0 && !buf->ri_lock) into two Asserts.

Document.document: Make pg_dump dump ACL's by default, print warning on use of -z, and add new -x option to skip acl dump.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Get rid of page-level locking in btree-s. BT_READ/BT_WRITE are BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE/BUFFER_LOCK_EXCLUSIVE now. Also get rid of #define BT_VERSION_1 - we use version 1 as default for near two years now.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Get rid of page-level locking in btree-s. LockBuffer is used to acquire read/write access to index pages. Pages are released before leaving index internals.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: On AIX 4.3.2 the third line in template/aix_42: SHARED_LIB: needs to be changed to: SHARED_LIB:-lc I think this was also needed on AIX 4.2. Comments Please !! If nobody objects, I suggest to make this change, since it cannot break AIX 4.2 and is necessary on AIX 4.3 Andreas

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Thanks for this, but SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL should be described like SET TIME ZONE: TO is not allowed, as well as DEFAULT option. There are only two forms: for Vadim.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Additional fix against ERROR: Child itemid marked as unused in CommitTransaction(). 2. Changes in GetSnapshotData().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair performance problem in SI segment manipulations: iterating through MAXBACKENDS array entries used to be fine when MAXBACKENDS = 64. It's not so cool with MAXBACKENDS = 1024 (or more!), especially not in a frequently-used routine like SIDelExpiredDataEntries. Repair by making procState array size be the soft MaxBackends limit rather than the hard limit, and by converting SIGetProcStateLimit() to a macro.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. xact.c: update comments about changing MyProc->xid and MyProc->xmin. 2. varsup.c:ReadNewTransactionId(): don't read nextXid from disk - this func doesn't allocate next xid, so ShmemVariableCache->nextXid may be used (but GetNewTransactionId() must be called first). 3. vacuum.c: change elog(ERROR, "Child item....") to elog(NOTICE) - this is not ERROR, proper handling is just not implemented, yet. 4. s_lock.c: increase S_MAX_BUSY by 2 times. 5. shmem.c:GetSnapshotData(): have to call ReadNewTransactionId() _after_ SpinAcquire(ShmemIndexLock).

This fixes its failure to cope with (at least) CaseExpr and ArrayRef nodes, which is the reason why both of these fail in 6.5: select coalesce(f1,0) from int4_tbl group by f1SEMICOLON ERROR: Illegal use of aggregates or non-group column in target list select sentence.words[0] from sentence group by sentence.words[0]SEMICOLON ERROR: Illegal use of aggregates or non-group column in target list The array case still fails, but at least it's not parse_agg's fault anymore ... considering that we now support CASE officially, I think it's important to fix the first example ...

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: I used bad style of comments and ... commented out some code in EvalPlanQualNext() when implemented it... -:) Uncommented...

Document.document: Round up shmem size estimate to 1Kb boundary.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Fix xid table sizing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When closure of the backend connection is detected during pqFlush, do the right thing: look for a NOTICE message from the backend before we close our side of the socket. 6.4 libpq did not reliably print the backend's hara-kiri message, 'The Postmaster has informed me ...', because it only did the right thing if connection closure was detected during a read attempt instead of a write attempt.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make functions static or NOT_USED as appropriate.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Remove User's Guide entities since they were not being used.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The references to mailing lists in the resources page seem outdated. Patch attached. Fred Horch

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove query_planner's overhasty rejection of cases where tlist and qual are NULL. It ought to handle these the same as the cases where tlist contains only constant expressions, ie, be willing to generate a Result-node plan. This did not use to matter, but it does now because union_planner will flatten the tlist when aggregates are present. Thus, 'select count(1) from table' now causes query_planner to be given a null tlist, and to duplicate 6.4's behavior we need it to give back a Result plan rather than refusing the query. 6.4 was arguably doing the Wrong Thing for this query, but I'm not going to open a semantics issue right before 6.5 release ... can revisit that problem later.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I attach a patch for pg_upgrade. This does two things: 1. check whether the program is being executed in $PGDATA/.. This is necessary if the data tree is not in the standard place, as is the case with the Debian distribution (because of Debian policy). 2. give a clearer error message if the dumped data structure fails to be loaded. Oliver Elphick

Document.document: Turns out OIDNAMELEN wasn't really being used at all! Get rid of it to make customization of NAMEDATALEN easier.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL SERIALIZABLESEMICOLON SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL READ COMMITTEDSEMICOLON ^^^^ required Also note that SET TRANSACTION ISOLATION LEVEL change isolevel for _current_ transaction, in accordance with standard, not for session (ALTER SESSION is used in Oracle, but it's not implemented currently). And I would don't mention SET XACTISOLEVEL TO ... form at all. Please update set.sgml - I failed to understand all these SET TIME ZONE { '<REPLACEABLE CLASS="PARAMETER"> now. for Vadim

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: ecpg.patch (wrong makefile expansion in some cases) the ecpg Makefiles use a variable DESTDIR which is never defined except by debian/rules makefile, in which case the ecpg makefiles expand wrong pathnames. If we want to support a DESTDIR root it must be done consistently in all the makefiles, not just in ecpg. From: Massimo Dal Zotto <dz@cs.unitn.it>

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Move default NBuffers setting into config.h, and rename it to DEF_NBUFFERS for readability. Make sure the default value is OK according to postmaster.c's new sanity check for -B values.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: When targetlist is NULL, ExecTargetList was passing back a pointer to palloc'd but uninitialized memory. This is not coolSEMICOLON anyone looking at the returned 'tuple' would at best coredump and at worst behave in a bizarre and irreproducible way. Fix it to return a predictable value, namely a correctly-set-up palloc'd tuple containing zero attributes. I believe this fix is both safe and critical.

Document.document: Update from Massimo

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hi, I have updated my contrib code for version 6.5. In the attachment you will find the directories array, datetime, miscutil, string, tools and userlocks which replace the corresponding directories under contrib. In contrib/tools you will find some developement scripts which I use while hacking the sources. I hope they will be useful for some other people. I have also added a contrib/Makefile which tries to compile and install all the contribs. Unfortunately many of them don't have a Makefile or don't compile cleanly. -- Massimo Dal Zotto

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove redeclarations of default parameter values from PgDatabase::DisplayTuples and PgDatabase::PrintTuples. This is incorrect according to strict interpretation of the C++ spec, and some compilers will reject it. Also silence g++ warning about unused parameter.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update of release notes with new items.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Installation notes for v6.5. Generated from install.sgml and installation.sgml.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid redundant SysCache searches in coerce_type, for another few percent speedup in INSERT...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update release notes for 6.5.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Display numeric precision on BACKSLASHd.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add information on generating INSTALL and HISTORY from sgml sources.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Cut down to 80 columns per Bruce. Mostly hacked at the porting table.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix typos and wording in v6.5 release summary per Fred Horsh.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ's for release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress indexes on large objects from psql's BACKSLASHd listingSEMICOLON they were confusing because the large object tables themselves are not shown. (Besides, if you've got hundreds or thousands of large objects, you really don't want to see 'em at all.) Also, suppress all indexes from the BACKSLASHz ACL listing, since indexes have no meaningful protection information.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add a mention of doc changes in the release notes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add mention of FOR UPDATE and LIMIT/OFFSET>

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make separate subsection for Vadim's MVCC notes. Add timing info for v6.5 on my linux box.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up uninitialized-variable warning from egcs. (Curious that gcc doesn't complain about this code...).

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Refresh FreeBSD info.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Significant update from Vince Vielhaber.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix compile of plpgsql by adding 'extern int yylineno.'

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Clarify input/output timezone information. Add detail on exact interpretation of "concatenated date" for various lengths.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Put in CREATE TABLE AS and SELECT INTO reference pages. Left them out after splitting them from the CREATE TABLE and SELECT sources.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Plug hole in dike: planner would coredump if query_planner returned NULL, which it will do in some cases where an elog(ERROR) would probably be more appropriate. For the moment, generate a not-very- informative error message rather than proceeding to certain coredump. Probably ought to think about making query_planner elog instead of returning NULL, but this is at least a safe change for now.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Removed bad Assert(!buf->ri_lock) when unlocking exclusively locked buffer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove optimization on linux/alpha.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Here is a small patch that should only affect win32 building > (native win32, not cygnus). > It does the following: > Patches two win32.mak files to DEFINE HAVE_VSNPRINTF and > HAVE_STRDUP. This is required to build at all. > Bumps the version number on libpq.dll from 6.4 to 6.5. > Required for install programs to work. > Adds defintions for BLCKSZ and MAXIMUM_ALIGN to "win32.h" in > the client-side libpiq directory. > > All these files are only used when building on native win32, > so it should be safe I think. > > Again, really sorry to throw this in so late, but I would > hate to do the same thing as with 6.4 (which required 6.4.1 > to at all compile on Win32). > > Thanks, > > //Magnus

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add configurable option controlling security checks in LO functions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update lock sgml/man/psql help pages.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix markup and formatting.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make sure that only one intro is included in the integrated doc. Multiple intros cause trouble since they have some section elements (e.g. "y2k.sgml") in common leading to duplicate labels. Include emacs formatting hints in the intro*.sgml sources.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up memory leaks in LO operations by freeing LO's private memory context at transaction commit or abort.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Remove disclaimer about exact numeric types. They work now!

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: I am not sure if libpq++ will compile with non g++ compilers, but the Makefile does break non g++. <<mak.patch>> Andreas

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: add m86 similar entries.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Reset evaluation plan tuple table next free slot counter to 0 after ExecEndNode. It must be done! Or we'll be out of free tuple slots very soon, though slots are freed by ExecEndNode and ready for reusing. We didn't see this problem before because of int nSlots = ExecCountSlotsNode(plan)SEMICOLON TupleTable tupleTable = ExecCreateTupleTable(nSlots + 10)SEMICOLON /* why add ten? - jolly */ code in InitPlan - i.e. extra 10 slots. Simple select uses 3 slots and so it was possible to re-use evaluation plan 3 additional times and didn't get elog(NOTICE, "Plan requires more slots than are available")SEMICOLON elog(ERROR, "send mail to your local executor guru to fix this")SEMICOLON Changes are obvious and shouldn't be problems with them. Though, I added Assert(epqstate->es_tupleTable->next == 0) before EvalPlanQual():ExecInitNode and we'll notice if something is still wrong. Is it better to change Assert to elog(ERROR) ?

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair recently-introduced error in makeIndexable for LIKE: a non-leading % would be put into the >=/<= patterns. Also, repair longstanding confusion about whether %% means a literal %%. The SQL92 doesn't say any such thing, and textlike() knows that, but gram.y didn't.

Document.document: Update TODO.

Document.document: Update with more TODO items.

Document.document: Update of release notes with new items.

Document.document: Update psql help so it looks better.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: configure.in forgot to do AC_LANG_C to reselect C-based tests after checking for presence of C++ compiler. Odd we hadn't seen any reports of problems before...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up release sgml file.

Document.document: Add backup/restore info to Admin Guide. Split management chapter from start-ag.sgml to manage-ag.sgml.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make linux_ppc use only -O, not -O2.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Minor updates for release. Split reference pages for CREATE TABLE AS and SELECT INTO to allow psgml (the emacs parser) to handle parsing.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Minor updates for release.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Make minor changes in wording. Adjust tags to get a clean build.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: equal() needs a case for Aggref nodes, as shown by: regression=> select sum(q1) from int8_tbl group by q2 order by sum(q1)SEMICOLON NOTICE: equal: don't know whether nodes of type 107 are equal

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix for failure to clean SysCache entry when a relation is deleted in the same transaction that created it.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. MyProc->xid assignment is moved to GetNewTransactionId so newer transactions will not assume that MyProc transaction was committed before snapshot calculations. With old MyProc->xid assignment (in xact.c:StartTransaction()) there was ability to see the same row twice (I used gdb for this)!... 2. Assignments of InvalidTransactionId to MyProc->xid and MyProc->xmin are moved from xact.c:CommitTransaction() to xact.c:RecordTransactionCommit() - this invalidation must be done before releasing transaction locks or bad (too high) XmaxRecent value might be used by vacuum ("ERROR: Child itemid marked as unused" reported by "Hiroshi Inoue" <Inoue@tpf.co.jp>SEMICOLON once again, gdb allowed me reproduce this error).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up mention of gmake vs. make.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: FAQs contributed for this release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Temporarily disable error checks for missing selectivity functions, in order to work around oversight in 6.5 release: rtree index functions haven't got any. Mea culpa ...

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Incorporate fixes from Date and Darwen, 1997. Did not check the function declarations as carefully as the other parts, though all of the function names *do* match up with D&D.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: User's Guide for v6.5.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Change Assert(Ptp.t_data->t_xmax == tp.t_data->t_xmin) to : /* * Read above about cases when !ItemIdIsUsed(Citemid) * (child item is removed)... Due to the fact that * at the moment we don't remove unuseful part of * update-chain, it's possible to get too old * parent row here. Like as in the case which * caused this problem, we stop shrinking here. * I could try to find real parent row but want * not to do it because of real solution will * be implemented anyway, latter, and we are too * close to 6.5 release. - vadim 06/11/99 */ if (Ptp.t_data->t_xmax != tp.t_data->t_xmin) ...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Disable pg_upgrade for 6.5.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update faq and hpux faq.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: commented out PgConnection& references for now. May be using them later. Vince.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: More info is in sgml and html docs so this is now obsolete.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The references to mailing lists in the resources page seem outdated. Patch attached. Fred Horch

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Some suggestions to clarify the current status of PostgreSQL. Patch attached. Fred Horch

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove QUERY_LIMIT and documenation on same. Change _ALIGN to TYPEALIGN for Irix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix critical error noticed by Massimo: copy.c used to have a special hack to ensure it would close its output file even after failure due to elog(ERROR) partway through the copy. This is now unnecessary because fd.c takes care of cleaning up open files at transaction abortSEMICOLON worse, after fd.c closed the file copy.c would try to do so *again* at the start of the next COPY command. This would result in havoc in most implementations of stdio library.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix problems with grouping/aggregation in queries that use inheritance ... basically it was completely busted :-(

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: man.patch (make inconsistency) the default target is 'install' instead of 'all'. So if you do a make without target you actually do a make install, which is not what one normally expects from a standard makefile. From: Massimo Dal Zotto <dz@cs.unitn.it>

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: 1. Run all pg_dump queries in single serializable transaction. 2. Get rid of locking when updating statistics in vacuum. 3. Use QuerySnapshot in COPY TO and call SetQuerySnashot in main tcop loop before FETCH and COPY TO.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Missing semicolons in non-HAS_TEST_AND_SET code paths :-(

Document.document: Update pygresql version stamp.

Document.document: On second thought, expression_tree_walker should handle bare SubLink nodes after all ...

Document.document: Rename to vararg_format().

Document.document: Reversed out Massimo patch.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hi, please apply the included patch. It corrects the headers in src/win32 - there are some missing #endif. Dan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure consistent results when FormSortKeys fails to find all the expected keys (it was returning uninitialized memory).

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: typedef struct LTAG { Oid relIdSEMICOLON Oid dbIdSEMICOLON union { BlockNumber blknoSEMICOLON TransactionId xidSEMICOLON } objIdSEMICOLON > > Added: > /* > * offnum should be part of objId.tupleId above, but would increase > * sizeof(LOCKTAG) and so moved hereSEMICOLON currently used by userlocks only. > */ > OffsetNumber offnumSEMICOLON uint16 lockmethodSEMICOLON /* needed by userlocks */ } LOCKTAGSEMICOLON gmake clean required... User locks are ready for 6.5 release...

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: Release XactLockTable share lock immediately after this lock is acquired (no sense to hold it) or we'll be out of lock entries. Great thanks to Hiroshi Inoue.
